text: Can from Cold Storage Singapore, shared with Kermis. Poured a clear straw colour with a thin bubbly round head and a few bubbles. The aroma is malt, alcohol, some creamy yeast. The flavour is strong sweet with a caramel toffee alcoholic palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Can shared with and thanks to Jmgreenuk. Clear golden with barely any head. Aroma of malt, alcohol, grain and light caramel. Flavour is above moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter. Light to light medium bodied with light carbonation.
*Can in Singapore. More sticky and sweetish than the "Strong brew". Alcoholic, grain, malt.
50 cl. can. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flaovur of malt, fruit and alcohol.

Just to tick one off the list .  Can   pours  clear old gold colour   modest white head that just vanishes rapidly . aroma - well I got sweet honey with malts  . taste  - well I got sweet honey with malts and alcohol . very long alcohol afterglow . headbanging stuff but I have had a lot worse in this genre  - Special Brew hang your head in shame .
the srtrongest beer in my opinion but with a good taste, somewhat bitter but overall the best if you need to get drunk fast.

Can. Pours a viscous blonde, head gone in an instant. Sweet aroma, I swear I got some champagne in the nose.. Taste has detracting metallic twang, not so bad as expected though. Quite bitter. Alcohol definetely present. Didnt drainpour.. actually finished the whole damn thing... But the slightly weaker version at 8 or so % is a whole lot better.

Rich and full bodied. Complex character and decent scents. Very hard on the palate though. Despite its potential and promise, I do not find it an easy beer to handle, much less appreciate. Its very hard to reconcile all the palate reactions. This brew taxes the tongue and throat, not to mention the brain too. Unrefreshing. A bit like knocking your head on the wall.

Bottled. A golden beer with a thin off-white head. The aroma is sweet malty with light notes of cardboard and alcohol. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of alcohol, which leaves a slight burn on the palate. Too simple.
Golden colour with a white head. malty, grainy, light fruity sweet aroma. malty, grainy sweet flavor with bread and alcohol sweet notes.

From can, no 9 at Papsoes blindtasting. Pours clear and with a golden yellow to orange colour and with lacing white head. Malty and slight sweet almondish aroma. Full bodied. Sweet flavour, slight metallic. The marzipan/almond flavoured notes are quite subdued in the flavour. Ends mild metallic and solid alcohol warming. Nice.

(Can 50 cl) Courtesy of fiulijn. Clear, golden with an off-white head - some tiny impurities. Very sweet, malty nose with a distinct alcohol. Quite full-bodied, sweetish malty with a burning alcohol in the finish. No bitterness though. Still a fairly drinkable Malt Liquor. 301107
Can. A pale golden beer with a white head. The aroma is light sweet malty, the taste is sweet malty, light caramel and almon. Medium body with a sweet light alcoholic finish.

#9 [Blind tasting session @ Papsoe 30-11-2007] Small fizzy white head that quickly was goon. Clear flat looking body with a pale golden color. Fair lacework. Aroma of grain, caramel, toffee and bread. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and light dry texture. Moderated sweet flavor. Sweet bread like finish. Alex thinks it has 7.5% alcohol. René thinks it is a Helle bock

Can.
Clear yellow coloured with a white head.
Sweet aroma of malts, caramel and fruits with notes of alcohol.
Sweet flavour of malts, caramel, fruits and alcohol.
Hoppy and burning alcoholic finish.
2007-11-30, Papsøs Blind TastingCanBlond color. Light aroma, straws and vegetables. Thick body, a bit oily, burning alcohol. Not bad flavors, mostly I recon their absence.
Can. Pours a pale golden colour with a few floaties. Sweet malty aroma with alcohol. The flavour is sweet with some bitterness, grains and alcohol. Sweet alco finish.
